content: All over the news, Google if ya want other POCs. *http://www.stoptheaclu.com/archives/2009/04/03/obama-calls-america-arrogant-during-speech-in-strasbourg/ Proud Arrogant American here, Obama bad mouthed us in Europe this week as such, I am proud to be one. *uc* Him! For a guy that wanted to be President so bad he sure doesn't seem to like anything about this country, or his wife till now for that matter. Think about it, OUR PRESIDENT BAD MOUTHED US, THE CITIZENS HE REPRESENTS, IN ANOTHER COUNTRY. More blame America First. Maybe he is in campaign mode again, going on for President of the NWO? What a sell-out. I don't care what your beliefs are,there is something going on with this. Bows to sponsors of anti-Americanism, Olive Branch to terrorist organizations vowing the destruction of the West (us), bad mouthing America as the root of all that is wrong in the world. Not letting banks repay money to get out of Gov control, legislation to take control and/or shut down the internet. (They want to be able to look into any ones online activity, where are all the Bush wire tap whiners on this?) Firing people in private companies, wanting limited pay in private companies. West Wing Aides got millions for brokering Bail-out deals, no outrage. All these corrupted appointees. What is going on with this guy? How can some people keep blowing all this off as nothing? Maybe Arrogant comes from going all over the world every time there is trouble while Europe Sends usually token forces or supplies? Maybe Arrogance comes from giving more money to charity from Private Citizens than the value of many countries GDP? Maybe Arrogance comes from taking care of our citizens, Mexico-Central-and South American refugees from their impoverished and/or greedy leadership. Maybe Arrogance comes from being on the moon, creating more in our short couple centuries than Europe did in millennia. Maybe it come in the way our immigrants (legal ones anyway) assimilate here, yet riot and burn neighborhoods in France and plot to blow up planes with their babies in Britain. Maybe it is Arrogance in that we have a lower crime rate per capita than many countries that don’t allow a version of our 2nd Amendment. Maybe it is Arrogance in KNOWING that for all the whining, crying, finger pointing, and hating America, when Crap-Hits-The –Fan who is it the world calls on to spend their wealth, give their supplies and to bleed and maybe die…..Americans. It isn’t the US government that fights and gives to the troubled parts of the world….It is the America People. So if Obama can’t handle that, he can resign anytime he decides this country, Its People, and Its Ideals are too much for him….. I think tomorrow would be a good day to get more ammo. This message has been edited. Last edited by: carsleyt, Sun 05 April 2009 06:22 PM

content: Gee, I wonder what happens when the speech is posted in context: In recent years we've allowed our Alliance to drift. I know that there have been honest disagreements over policy, but we also know that there's something more that has crept into our relationship. In America, there's a failure to appreciate Europe's leading role in the world. Instead of celebrating your dynamic union and seeking to partner with you to meet common challenges, there have been times where America has shown arrogance and been dismissive, even derisive. But in Europe, there is an anti-Americanism that is at once casual but can also be insidious. Instead of recognizing the good that America so often does in the world, there have been times where Europeans choose to blame America for much of what's bad. On both sides of the Atlantic, these attitudes have become all too common. They are not wise. They do not represent the truth. They threaten to widen the divide across the Atlantic and leave us both more isolated. They fail to acknowledge the fundamental truth that America cannot confront the challenges of this century alone, but that Europe cannot confront them without America.

content: SignalSgtWilliams and badmac933 have given good comments about this fiasco. There was no reason to equate the USA with Europe in making mistakes of "arrogance". It reminds me of Michelle's (his wife's) "For the first time I am proud to be an American". These are not simply TV slips of the tongue - the tell us about an attitude that is reflected in the detailed backgrounds of the people involved, because we know one heck of a lot about their backgrounds including long-time attending Church where the Ministers made these kinds of statements often, working/volunteering in organizations alongside Terrorists, and on and on. I don't know how many people on Military.com know of the Polls that have been made over the years about USA black Ethnic Group attitudes toward the USA, but they do tend to fall not only into Obama's and Michelle's statement types but often much worse including sympathy for Terrorists, for the USSR, for Russia, for China, for Cuba, for Criminals, etc. Osher Doctorow

content: This administration has been blaming our country quite a bit. SECSTATE Clinton, has blamed Mexico's problems on us. Attorney Gen Eric Holder has called us a nation of cowards. He also blamed US for Mexico's gun problem. With his false accusations, he even recommended restricting our second amendment rights on fabricated, and unfounded BS. He blamed US, instead of Mexico, their military (whom has deserted in astonishing numbers), the cartels, and so on. So now, Obama wants to disarm us, while other countries are looking to increase their arsenals. There is a reason for us maintaining our nuclear arsenal. It is called deterrence. Does he think that if he disarms us, everyone else will follow? It will only make us more vulnerable. The man needs to step into reality. NK just fired a missile. The words he used weren't strong. Rather, it was a weak scolding. When Reagan told Gorbachev to "tear down this wall"...was he there blaming previous administrations, trying to apologize and so on? Hell no. When he inherited a horrible economy, did he sit there, crying about Carter? No, he took action. Blaming and so on was handled at the debates. Now we have an administration that is blaming us for the worlds problems, instead of dealing with them. Or, they choose to deal with them trying to restrict our rights. That is a bunch of BS. How some of you can stand for it is beyond me.

content: All over the news, Google if ya want other POCs. *http://www.stoptheaclu.com/archives/2009/04/03/obama-calls-america-arrogant-during-speech-in-strasbourg/ Proud Arrogant American here, Obama bad mouthed us in Europe this week as such, I am proud to be one. *uc* Him! For a guy that wanted to be President so bad he sure doesn't seem to like anything about this country, or his wife till now for that matter. Think about it, OUR PRESIDENT BAD MOUTHED US, THE CITIZENS HE REPRESENTS, IN ANOTHER COUNTRY. More blame America First. Maybe he is in campaign mode again, going on for President of the NWO? What a sell-out. I don't care what your beliefs are,there is something going on with this. Bows to sponsors of anti-Americanism, Olive Branch to terrorist organizations vowing the destruction of the West (us), bad mouthing America as the root of all that is wrong in the world. Not letting banks repay money to get out of Gov control, legislation to take control and/or shut down the internet. (They want to be able to look into any ones online activity, where are all the Bush wire tap whiners on this?) Firing people in private companies, wanting limited pay in private companies. West Wing Aides got millions for brokering Bail-out deals, no outrage. All these corrupted appointees. What is going on with this guy? How can some people keep blowing all this off as nothing? Maybe Arrogant comes from going all over the world every time there is trouble while Europe Sends usually token forces or supplies? Maybe Arrogance comes from giving more money to charity from Private Citizens than the value of many countries GDP? Maybe Arrogance comes from taking care of our citizens, Mexico-Central-and South American refugees from their impoverished and/or greedy leadership. Maybe Arrogance comes from being on the moon, creating more in our short couple centuries than Europe did in millennia. Maybe it come in the way our immigrants (legal ones anyway) assimilate here, yet riot and burn neighborhoods in France and plot to blow up planes with their babies in Britain. Maybe it is Arrogance in that we have a lower crime rate per capita than many countries that don’t allow a version of our 2nd Amendment. Maybe it is Arrogance in KNOWING that for all the whining, crying, finger pointing, and hating America, when Crap-Hits-The –Fan who is it the world calls on to spend their wealth, give their supplies and to bleed and maybe die…..Americans. It isn’t the US government that fights and gives to the troubled parts of the world….It is the America People. So if Obama can’t handle that, he can resign anytime he decides this country, Its People, and Its Ideals are too much for him….. I think tomorrow would be a good day to get more ammo. content: Gee, I wonder what happens when the speech is posted in context: In recent years we've allowed our Alliance to drift. I know that there have been honest disagreements over policy, but we also know that there's something more that has crept into our relationship. In America, there's a failure to appreciate Europe's leading role in the world. Instead of celebrating your dynamic union and seeking to partner with you to meet common challenges, there have been times where America has shown arrogance and been dismissive, even derisive. But in Europe, there is an anti-Americanism that is at once casual but can also be insidious. Instead of recognizing the good that America so often does in the world, there have been times where Europeans choose to blame America for much of what's bad. On both sides of the Atlantic, these attitudes have become all too common. They are not wise. They do not represent the truth. They threaten to widen the divide across the Atlantic and leave us both more isolated. They fail to acknowledge the fundamental truth that America cannot confront the challenges of this century alone, but that Europe cannot confront them without America.

content: This administration has been blaming our country quite a bit. SECSTATE Clinton, has blamed Mexico's problems on us. Attorney Gen Eric Holder has called us a nation of cowards. He also blamed US for Mexico's gun problem. With his false accusations, he even recommended restricting our second amendment rights on fabricated, and unfounded BS. He blamed US, instead of Mexico, their military (whom has deserted in astonishing numbers), the cartels, and so on. So now, Obama wants to disarm us, while other countries are looking to increase their arsenals. There is a reason for us maintaining our nuclear arsenal. It is called deterrence. Does he think that if he disarms us, everyone else will follow? It will only make us more vulnerable. The man needs to step into reality. NK just fired a missile. The words he used weren't strong. Rather, it was a weak scolding. When Reagan told Gorbachev to "tear down this wall"...was he there blaming previous administrations, trying to apologize and so on? Hell no. When he inherited a horrible economy, did he sit there, crying about Carter? No, he took action. Blaming and so on was handled at the debates. Now we have an administration that is blaming us for the worlds problems, instead of dealing with them. Or, they choose to deal with them trying to restrict our rights. That is a bunch of BS. How some of you can stand for it is beyond me.

content: All over the news, Google if ya want other POCs. *http://www.stoptheaclu.com/archives/2009/04/03/obama-calls-america-arrogant-during-speech-in-strasbourg/ Proud Arrogant American here, Obama bad mouthed us in Europe this week as such, I am proud to be one. *uc* Him! For a guy that wanted to be President so bad he sure doesn't seem to like anything about this country, or his wife till now for that matter. Think about it, OUR PRESIDENT BAD MOUTHED US, THE CITIZENS HE REPRESENTS, IN ANOTHER COUNTRY. More blame America First. Maybe he is in campaign mode again, going on for President of the NWO? What a sell-out. I don't care what your beliefs are,there is something going on with this. Bows to sponsors of anti-Americanism, Olive Branch to terrorist organizations vowing the destruction of the West (us), bad mouthing America as the root of all that is wrong in the world. Not letting banks repay money to get out of Gov control, legislation to take control and/or shut down the internet. (They want to be able to look into any ones online activity, where are all the Bush wire tap whiners on this?) Firing people in private companies, wanting limited pay in private companies. West Wing Aides got millions for brokering Bail-out deals, no outrage. All these corrupted appointees. What is going on with this guy? How can some people keep blowing all this off as nothing? Maybe Arrogant comes from going all over the world every time there is trouble while Europe Sends usually token forces or supplies? Maybe Arrogance comes from giving more money to charity from Private Citizens than the value of many countries GDP? Maybe Arrogance comes from taking care of our citizens, Mexico-Central-and South American refugees from their impoverished and/or greedy leadership. Maybe Arrogance comes from being on the moon, creating more in our short couple centuries than Europe did in millennia. Maybe it come in the way our immigrants (legal ones anyway) assimilate here, yet riot and burn neighborhoods in France and plot to blow up planes with their babies in Britain. Maybe it is Arrogance in that we have a lower crime rate per capita than many countries that don’t allow a version of our 2nd Amendment. Maybe it is Arrogance in KNOWING that for all the whining, crying, finger pointing, and hating America, when Crap-Hits-The –Fan who is it the world calls on to spend their wealth, give their supplies and to bleed and maybe die…..Americans. It isn’t the US government that fights and gives to the troubled parts of the world….It is the America People. So if Obama can’t handle that, he can resign anytime he decides this country, Its People, and Its Ideals are too much for him….. I think tomorrow would be a good day to get more ammo. This message has been edited. Last edited by: carsleyt, Sun 05 April 2009 06:22 PM

content: quote: Originally posted by mcgreer: quote: Originally posted by carsleyt: All over the news, Google if ya want other POCs. *http://www.stoptheaclu.com/archives/2009/04/03/obama-calls-america-arrogant-during-speech-in-strasbourg/ Proud Arrogant American here, Obama bad mouthed us in Europe this week as such, I am proud to be one. *uc* Him! For a guy that wanted to be President so bad he sure doesn't seem to like anything about this country, or his wife till now for that matter. Think about it, OUR PRESIDENT BAD MOUTHED US, THE CITIZENS HE REPRESENTS, IN ANOTHER COUNTRY. More blame America First. Maybe he is in campaign mode again, going on for President of the NWO? What a sell-out. I don't care what your beliefs are,there is something going on with this. Bows to sponsors of anti-Americanism, Olive Branch to terrorist organizations vowing the destruction of the West (us), bad mouthing America as the root of all that is wrong in the world. Not letting banks repay money to get out of Gov control, legislation to take control and/or shut down the internet. (They want to be able to look into any ones online activity, where are all the Bush wire tap whiners on this?) Firing people in private companies, wanting limited pay in private companies. West Wing Aides got millions for brokering Bail-out deals, no outrage. All these corrupted appointees. What is going on with this guy? How can some people keep blowing all this off as nothing? Maybe Arrogant comes from going all over the world every time there is trouble while Europe Sends usually token forces or supplies? Maybe Arrogance comes from giving more money to charity from Private Citizens than the value of many countries GDP? Maybe Arrogance comes from taking care of our citizens, Mexico-Central-and South American refugees from their impoverished and/or greedy leadership. Maybe Arrogance comes from being on the moon, creating more in our short couple centuries than Europe did in millennia. Maybe it come in the way our immigrants (legal ones anyway) assimilate here, yet riot and burn neighborhoods in France and plot to blow up planes with their babies in Britain. Maybe it is Arrogance in that we have a lower crime rate per capita than many countries that don’t allow a version of our 2nd Amendment. Maybe it is Arrogance in KNOWING that for all the whining, crying, finger pointing, and hating America, when Crap-Hits-The –Fan who is it the world calls on to spend their wealth, give their supplies and to bleed and maybe die…..Americans. It isn’t the US government that fights and gives to the troubled parts of the world….It is the America People. So if Obama can’t handle that, he can resign anytime he decides this country, Its People, and Its Ideals are too much for him….. I think tomorrow would be a good day to get more ammo. ...for what? When this country falls apart into the 3rd World nation O wants us to be, to protect my family. Also gathering seeds, canned goods and, solar generator, and bottled water. If these 546 nuts in charge keep at it, we're gonna headed for worse times. This message has been edited. Last edited by: carsleyt, Sun 05 April 2009 07:19 PM

content: Gee, I wonder what happens when the speech is posted in context: In recent years we've allowed our Alliance to drift. I know that there have been honest disagreements over policy, but we also know that there's something more that has crept into our relationship. In America, there's a failure to appreciate Europe's leading role in the world. Instead of celebrating your dynamic union and seeking to partner with you to meet common challenges, there have been times where America has shown arrogance and been dismissive, even derisive. But in Europe, there is an anti-Americanism that is at once casual but can also be insidious. Instead of recognizing the good that America so often does in the world, there have been times where Europeans choose to blame America for much of what's bad. On both sides of the Atlantic, these attitudes have become all too common. They are not wise. They do not represent the truth. They threaten to widen the divide across the Atlantic and leave us both more isolated. They fail to acknowledge the fundamental truth that America cannot confront the challenges of this century alone, but that Europe cannot confront them without America.

content: This administration has been blaming our country quite a bit. SECSTATE Clinton, has blamed Mexico's problems on us. Attorney Gen Eric Holder has called us a nation of cowards. He also blamed US for Mexico's gun problem. With his false accusations, he even recommended restricting our second amendment rights on fabricated, and unfounded BS. He blamed US, instead of Mexico, their military (whom has deserted in astonishing numbers), the cartels, and so on. So now, Obama wants to disarm us, while other countries are looking to increase their arsenals. There is a reason for us maintaining our nuclear arsenal. It is called deterrence. Does he think that if he disarms us, everyone else will follow? It will only make us more vulnerable. The man needs to step into reality. NK just fired a missile. The words he used weren't strong. Rather, it was a weak scolding. When Reagan told Gorbachev to "tear down this wall"...was he there blaming previous administrations, trying to apologize and so on? Hell no. When he inherited a horrible economy, did he sit there, crying about Carter? No, he took action. Blaming and so on was handled at the debates. Now we have an administration that is blaming us for the worlds problems, instead of dealing with them. Or, they choose to deal with them trying to restrict our rights. That is a bunch of BS. How some of you can stand for it is beyond me.

Maybe Arrogance comes from giving more money to charity from Private Citizens than the value of many countries GDP? Maybe Arrogance comes from taking care of our citizens, Mexico-Central-and South American refugees from their impoverished and/or greedy leadership. Maybe Arrogance comes from being on the moon, creating more in our short couple centuries than Europe did in millennia. Maybe it come in the way our immigrants (legal ones anyway) assimilate here, yet riot and burn neighborhoods in France and plot to blow up planes with their babies in Britain. Maybe it is Arrogance in that we have a lower crime rate per capita than many countries that don’t allow a version of our 2nd Amendment. Maybe it is Arrogance in KNOWING that for all the whining, crying, finger pointing, and hating America, when Crap-Hits-The –Fan who is it the world calls on to spend their wealth, give their supplies and to bleed and maybe die…..Americans. content: Gee, I wonder what happens when the speech is posted in context: In recent years we've allowed our Alliance to drift. I know that there have been honest disagreements over policy, but we also know that there's something more that has crept into our relationship. In America, there's a failure to appreciate Europe's leading role in the world. Instead of celebrating your dynamic union and seeking to partner with you to meet common challenges, there have been times where America has shown arrogance and been dismissive, even derisive. But in Europe, there is an anti-Americanism that is at once casual but can also be insidious. Instead of recognizing the good that America so often does in the world, there have been times where Europeans choose to blame America for much of what's bad. On both sides of the Atlantic, these attitudes have become all too common. They are not wise. They do not represent the truth. They threaten to widen the divide across the Atlantic and leave us both more isolated. They fail to acknowledge the fundamental truth that America cannot confront the challenges of this century alone, but that Europe cannot confront them without America.

content: This administration has been blaming our country quite a bit. SECSTATE Clinton, has blamed Mexico's problems on us. Attorney Gen Eric Holder has called us a nation of cowards. He also blamed US for Mexico's gun problem. With his false accusations, he even recommended restricting our second amendment rights on fabricated, and unfounded BS. He blamed US, instead of Mexico, their military (whom has deserted in astonishing numbers), the cartels, and so on. So now, Obama wants to disarm us, while other countries are looking to increase their arsenals. There is a reason for us maintaining our nuclear arsenal. It is called deterrence. Does he think that if he disarms us, everyone else will follow? It will only make us more vulnerable. The man needs to step into reality. NK just fired a missile. The words he used weren't strong. Rather, it was a weak scolding. When Reagan told Gorbachev to "tear down this wall"...was he there blaming previous administrations, trying to apologize and so on? Hell no. When he inherited a horrible economy, did he sit there, crying about Carter? No, he took action. Blaming and so on was handled at the debates. Now we have an administration that is blaming us for the worlds problems, instead of dealing with them. Or, they choose to deal with them trying to restrict our rights. That is a bunch of BS. How some of you can stand for it is beyond me.

content: All over the news, Google if ya want other POCs. *http://www.stoptheaclu.com/archives/2009/04/03/obama-calls-america-arrogant-during-speech-in-strasbourg/ Proud Arrogant American here, Obama bad mouthed us in Europe this week as such, I am proud to be one. *uc* Him! For a guy that wanted to be President so bad he sure doesn't seem to like anything about this country, or his wife till now for that matter. Think about it, OUR PRESIDENT BAD MOUTHED US, THE CITIZENS HE REPRESENTS, IN ANOTHER COUNTRY. More blame America First. Maybe he is in campaign mode again, going on for President of the NWO? What a sell-out. I don't care what your beliefs are,there is something going on with this. Bows to sponsors of anti-Americanism, Olive Branch to terrorist organizations vowing the destruction of the West (us), bad mouthing America as the root of all that is wrong in the world. Not letting banks repay money to get out of Gov control, legislation to take control and/or shut down the internet. (They want to be able to look into any ones online activity, where are all the Bush wire tap whiners on this?) Firing people in private companies, wanting limited pay in private companies. West Wing Aides got millions for brokering Bail-out deals, no outrage. All these corrupted appointees. What is going on with this guy? How can some people keep blowing all this off as nothing? Maybe Arrogant comes from going all over the world every time there is trouble while Europe Sends usually token forces or supplies? Maybe Arrogance comes from giving more money to charity from Private Citizens than the value of many countries GDP? Maybe Arrogance comes from taking care of our citizens, Mexico-Central-and South American refugees from their impoverished and/or greedy leadership. Maybe Arrogance comes from being on the moon, creating more in our short couple centuries than Europe did in millennia. Maybe it come in the way our immigrants (legal ones anyway) assimilate here, yet riot and burn neighborhoods in France and plot to blow up planes with their babies in Britain. Maybe it is Arrogance in that we have a lower crime rate per capita than many countries that don’t allow a version of our 2nd Amendment. Maybe it is Arrogance in KNOWING that for all the whining, crying, finger pointing, and hating America, when Crap-Hits-The –Fan who is it the world calls on to spend their wealth, give their supplies and to bleed and maybe die…..Americans. It isn’t the US government that fights and gives to the troubled parts of the world….It is the America People. So if Obama can’t handle that, he can resign anytime he decides this country, Its People, and Its Ideals are too much for him….. I think tomorrow would be a good day to get more ammo. content: Gee, I wonder what happens when the speech is posted in context: In recent years we've allowed our Alliance to drift. I know that there have been honest disagreements over policy, but we also know that there's something more that has crept into our relationship. In America, there's a failure to appreciate Europe's leading role in the world. Instead of celebrating your dynamic union and seeking to partner with you to meet common challenges, there have been times where America has shown arrogance and been dismissive, even derisive. But in Europe, there is an anti-Americanism that is at once casual but can also be insidious. Instead of recognizing the good that America so often does in the world, there have been times where Europeans choose to blame America for much of what's bad. On both sides of the Atlantic, these attitudes have become all too common. They are not wise. They do not represent the truth. They threaten to widen the divide across the Atlantic and leave us both more isolated. They fail to acknowledge the fundamental truth that America cannot confront the challenges of this century alone, but that Europe cannot confront them without America.

content: This administration has been blaming our country quite a bit. SECSTATE Clinton, has blamed Mexico's problems on us. Attorney Gen Eric Holder has called us a nation of cowards. He also blamed US for Mexico's gun problem. With his false accusations, he even recommended restricting our second amendment rights on fabricated, and unfounded BS. He blamed US, instead of Mexico, their military (whom has deserted in astonishing numbers), the cartels, and so on. So now, Obama wants to disarm us, while other countries are looking to increase their arsenals. There is a reason for us maintaining our nuclear arsenal. It is called deterrence. Does he think that if he disarms us, everyone else will follow? It will only make us more vulnerable. The man needs to step into reality. NK just fired a missile. The words he used weren't strong. Rather, it was a weak scolding. When Reagan told Gorbachev to "tear down this wall"...was he there blaming previous administrations, trying to apologize and so on? Hell no. When he inherited a horrible economy, did he sit there, crying about Carter? No, he took action. Blaming and so on was handled at the debates. Now we have an administration that is blaming us for the worlds problems, instead of dealing with them. Or, they choose to deal with them trying to restrict our rights. That is a bunch of BS. How some of you can stand for it is beyond me.

content: All over the news, Google if ya want other POCs. *http://www.stoptheaclu.com/archives/2009/04/03/obama-calls-america-arrogant-during-speech-in-strasbourg/ Proud Arrogant American here, Obama bad mouthed us in Europe this week as such, I am proud to be one. *uc* Him! For a guy that wanted to be President so bad he sure doesn't seem to like anything about this country, or his wife till now for that matter. Think about it, OUR PRESIDENT BAD MOUTHED US, THE CITIZENS HE REPRESENTS, IN ANOTHER COUNTRY. More blame America First. Maybe he is in campaign mode again, going on for President of the NWO? What a sell-out. I don't care what your beliefs are,there is something going on with this. Bows to sponsors of anti-Americanism, Olive Branch to terrorist organizations vowing the destruction of the West (us), bad mouthing America as the root of all that is wrong in the world. Not letting banks repay money to get out of Gov control, legislation to take control and/or shut down the internet. (They want to be able to look into any ones online activity, where are all the Bush wire tap whiners on this?) Firing people in private companies, wanting limited pay in private companies. West Wing Aides got millions for brokering Bail-out deals, no outrage. All these corrupted appointees. What is going on with this guy? How can some people keep blowing all this off as nothing? Maybe Arrogant comes from going all over the world every time there is trouble while Europe Sends usually token forces or supplies? Maybe Arrogance comes from giving more money to charity from Private Citizens than the value of many countries GDP? Maybe Arrogance comes from taking care of our citizens, Mexico-Central-and South American refugees from their impoverished and/or greedy leadership. Maybe Arrogance comes from being on the moon, creating more in our short couple centuries than Europe did in millennia. Maybe it come in the way our immigrants (legal ones anyway) assimilate here, yet riot and burn neighborhoods in France and plot to blow up planes with their babies in Britain. Maybe it is Arrogance in that we have a lower crime rate per capita than many countries that don’t allow a version of our 2nd Amendment. Maybe it is Arrogance in KNOWING that for all the whining, crying, finger pointing, and hating America, when Crap-Hits-The –Fan who is it the world calls on to spend their wealth, give their supplies and to bleed and maybe die…..Americans. It isn’t the US government that fights and gives to the troubled parts of the world….It is the America People. So if Obama can’t handle that, he can resign anytime he decides this country, Its People, and Its Ideals are too much for him….. I think tomorrow would be a good day to get more ammo. This message has been edited. Last edited by: carsleyt, Sun 05 April 2009 06:22 PM

content: Gee, I wonder what happens when the speech is posted in context: In recent years we've allowed our Alliance to drift. I know that there have been honest disagreements over policy, but we also know that there's something more that has crept into our relationship. In America, there's a failure to appreciate Europe's leading role in the world. Instead of celebrating your dynamic union and seeking to partner with you to meet common challenges, there have been times where America has shown arrogance and been dismissive, even derisive. But in Europe, there is an anti-Americanism that is at once casual but can also be insidious. Instead of recognizing the good that America so often does in the world, there have been times where Europeans choose to blame America for much of what's bad. On both sides of the Atlantic, these attitudes have become all too common. They are not wise. They do not represent the truth. They threaten to widen the divide across the Atlantic and leave us both more isolated. They fail to acknowledge the fundamental truth that America cannot confront the challenges of this century alone, but that Europe cannot confront them without America.

content: This administration has been blaming our country quite a bit. SECSTATE Clinton, has blamed Mexico's problems on us. Attorney Gen Eric Holder has called us a nation of cowards. He also blamed US for Mexico's gun problem. With his false accusations, he even recommended restricting our second amendment rights on fabricated, and unfounded BS. He blamed US, instead of Mexico, their military (whom has deserted in astonishing numbers), the cartels, and so on. So now, Obama wants to disarm us, while other countries are looking to increase their arsenals. There is a reason for us maintaining our nuclear arsenal. It is called deterrence. Does he think that if he disarms us, everyone else will follow? It will only make us more vulnerable. The man needs to step into reality. NK just fired a missile. The words he used weren't strong. Rather, it was a weak scolding. When Reagan told Gorbachev to "tear down this wall"...was he there blaming previous administrations, trying to apologize and so on? Hell no. When he inherited a horrible economy, did he sit there, crying about Carter? No, he took action. Blaming and so on was handled at the debates. Now we have an administration that is blaming us for the worlds problems, instead of dealing with them. Or, they choose to deal with them trying to restrict our rights. That is a bunch of BS. How some of you can stand for it is beyond me.

content: Gee, I wonder what happens when the speech is posted in context: In recent years we've allowed our Alliance to drift. I know that there have been honest disagreements over policy, but we also know that there's something more that has crept into our relationship. In America, there's a failure to appreciate Europe's leading role in the world. Instead of celebrating your dynamic union and seeking to partner with you to meet common challenges, there have been times where America has shown arrogance and been dismissive, even derisive. But in Europe, there is an anti-Americanism that is at once casual but can also be insidious. Instead of recognizing the good that America so often does in the world, there have been times where Europeans choose to blame America for much of what's bad. On both sides of the Atlantic, these attitudes have become all too common. They are not wise. They do not represent the truth. They threaten to widen the divide across the Atlantic and leave us both more isolated. They fail to acknowledge the fundamental truth that America cannot confront the challenges of this century alone, but that Europe cannot confront them without America.

content: This administration has been blaming our country quite a bit. SECSTATE Clinton, has blamed Mexico's problems on us. Attorney Gen Eric Holder has called us a nation of cowards. He also blamed US for Mexico's gun problem. With his false accusations, he even recommended restricting our second amendment rights on fabricated, and unfounded BS. He blamed US, instead of Mexico, their military (whom has deserted in astonishing numbers), the cartels, and so on. So now, Obama wants to disarm us, while other countries are looking to increase their arsenals. There is a reason for us maintaining our nuclear arsenal. It is called deterrence. Does he think that if he disarms us, everyone else will follow? It will only make us more vulnerable. The man needs to step into reality. NK just fired a missile. The words he used weren't strong. Rather, it was a weak scolding. When Reagan told Gorbachev to "tear down this wall"...was he there blaming previous administrations, trying to apologize and so on? Hell no. When he inherited a horrible economy, did he sit there, crying about Carter? No, he took action. Blaming and so on was handled at the debates. Now we have an administration that is blaming us for the worlds problems, instead of dealing with them. Or, they choose to deal with them trying to restrict our rights. That is a bunch of BS. How some of you can stand for it is beyond me.

title: Obama: America has been Arrogant.

content: All over the news, Google if ya want other POCs. *http://www.stoptheaclu.com/archives/2009/04/03/obama-calls-america-arrogant-during-speech-in-strasbourg/ Proud Arrogant American here, Obama bad mouthed us in Europe this week as such, I am proud to be one. *uc* Him! For a guy that wanted to be President so bad he sure doesn't seem to like anything about this country, or his wife till now for that matter. Think about it, OUR PRESIDENT BAD MOUTHED US, THE CITIZENS HE REPRESENTS, IN ANOTHER COUNTRY. More blame America First. Maybe he is in campaign mode again, going on for President of the NWO? What a sell-out. I don't care what your beliefs are,there is something going on with this. Bows to sponsors of anti-Americanism, Olive Branch to terrorist organizations vowing the destruction of the West (us), bad mouthing America as the root of all that is wrong in the world. Not letting banks repay money to get out of Gov control, legislation to take control and/or shut down the internet. (They want to be able to look into any ones online activity, where are all the Bush wire tap whiners on this?) Firing people in private companies, wanting limited pay in private companies. West Wing Aides got millions for brokering Bail-out deals, no outrage. All these corrupted appointees. What is going on with this guy? How can some people keep blowing all this off as nothing? Maybe Arrogant comes from going all over the world every time there is trouble while Europe Sends usually token forces or supplies? Maybe Arrogance comes from giving more money to charity from Private Citizens than the value of many countries GDP? Maybe Arrogance comes from taking care of our citizens, Mexico-Central-and South American refugees from their impoverished and/or greedy leadership. Maybe Arrogance comes from being on the moon, creating more in our short couple centuries than Europe did in millennia. Maybe it come in the way our immigrants (legal ones anyway) assimilate here, yet riot and burn neighborhoods in France and plot to blow up planes with their babies in Britain. Maybe it is Arrogance in that we have a lower crime rate per capita than many countries that don’t allow a version of our 2nd Amendment. Maybe it is Arrogance in KNOWING that for all the whining, crying, finger pointing, and hating America, when Crap-Hits-The –Fan who is it the world calls on to spend their wealth, give their supplies and to bleed and maybe die…..Americans. It isn’t the US government that fights and gives to the troubled parts of the world….It is the America People. So if Obama can’t handle that, he can resign anytime he decides this country, Its People, and Its Ideals are too much for him….. I think tomorrow would be a good day to get more ammo. This message has been edited. Last edited by: carsleyt, Sun 05 April 2009 06:22 PM

content: Gee, I wonder what happens when the speech is posted in context: In recent years we've allowed our Alliance to drift. I know that there have been honest disagreements over policy, but we also know that there's something more that has crept into our relationship. In America, there's a failure to appreciate Europe's leading role in the world. Instead of celebrating your dynamic union and seeking to partner with you to meet common challenges, there have been times where America has shown arrogance and been dismissive, even derisive. But in Europe, there is an anti-Americanism that is at once casual but can also be insidious. Instead of recognizing the good that America so often does in the world, there have been times where Europeans choose to blame America for much of what's bad. On both sides of the Atlantic, these attitudes have become all too common. They are not wise. They do not represent the truth. They threaten to widen the divide across the Atlantic and leave us both more isolated. They fail to acknowledge the fundamental truth that America cannot confront the challenges of this century alone, but that Europe cannot confront them without America.

content: SignalSgtWilliams and badmac933 have given good comments about this fiasco. There was no reason to equate the USA with Europe in making mistakes of "arrogance". It reminds me of Michelle's (his wife's) "For the first time I am proud to be an American". These are not simply TV slips of the tongue - the tell us about an attitude that is reflected in the detailed backgrounds of the people involved, because we know one heck of a lot about their backgrounds including long-time attending Church where the Ministers made these kinds of statements often, working/volunteering in organizations alongside Terrorists, and on and on. I don't know how many people on Military.com know of the Polls that have been made over the years about USA black Ethnic Group attitudes toward the USA, but they do tend to fall not only into Obama's and Michelle's statement types but often much worse including sympathy for Terrorists, for the USSR, for Russia, for China, for Cuba, for Criminals, etc. Osher Doctorow

content: This administration has been blaming our country quite a bit. SECSTATE Clinton, has blamed Mexico's problems on us. Attorney Gen Eric Holder has called us a nation of cowards. He also blamed US for Mexico's gun problem. With his false accusations, he even recommended restricting our second amendment rights on fabricated, and unfounded BS. He blamed US, instead of Mexico, their military (whom has deserted in astonishing numbers), the cartels, and so on. So now, Obama wants to disarm us, while other countries are looking to increase their arsenals. There is a reason for us maintaining our nuclear arsenal. It is called deterrence. Does he think that if he disarms us, everyone else will follow? It will only make us more vulnerable. The man needs to step into reality. NK just fired a missile. The words he used weren't strong. Rather, it was a weak scolding. When Reagan told Gorbachev to "tear down this wall"...was he there blaming previous administrations, trying to apologize and so on? Hell no. When he inherited a horrible economy, did he sit there, crying about Carter? No, he took action. Blaming and so on was handled at the debates. Now we have an administration that is blaming us for the worlds problems, instead of dealing with them. Or, they choose to deal with them trying to restrict our rights. That is a bunch of BS. How some of you can stand for it is beyond me.

content: All over the news, Google if ya want other POCs. *http://www.stoptheaclu.com/archives/2009/04/03/obama-calls-america-arrogant-during-speech-in-strasbourg/ Proud Arrogant American here, Obama bad mouthed us in Europe this week as such, I am proud to be one. *uc* Him! For a guy that wanted to be President so bad he sure doesn't seem to like anything about this country, or his wife till now for that matter. Think about it, OUR PRESIDENT BAD MOUTHED US, THE CITIZENS HE REPRESENTS, IN ANOTHER COUNTRY. More blame America First. Maybe he is in campaign mode again, going on for President of the NWO? What a sell-out. I don't care what your beliefs are,there is something going on with this. Bows to sponsors of anti-Americanism, Olive Branch to terrorist organizations vowing the destruction of the West (us), bad mouthing America as the root of all that is wrong in the world. Not letting banks repay money to get out of Gov control, legislation to take control and/or shut down the internet. (They want to be able to look into any ones online activity, where are all the Bush wire tap whiners on this?) Firing people in private companies, wanting limited pay in private companies. West Wing Aides got millions for brokering Bail-out deals, no outrage. All these corrupted appointees. What is going on with this guy? How can some people keep blowing all this off as nothing? Maybe Arrogant comes from going all over the world every time there is trouble while Europe Sends usually token forces or supplies? Maybe Arrogance comes from giving more money to charity from Private Citizens than the value of many countries GDP? Maybe Arrogance comes from taking care of our citizens, Mexico-Central-and South American refugees from their impoverished and/or greedy leadership. Maybe Arrogance comes from being on the moon, creating more in our short couple centuries than Europe did in millennia. Maybe it come in the way our immigrants (legal ones anyway) assimilate here, yet riot and burn neighborhoods in France and plot to blow up planes with their babies in Britain. Maybe it is Arrogance in that we have a lower crime rate per capita than many countries that don’t allow a version of our 2nd Amendment. Maybe it is Arrogance in KNOWING that for all the whining, crying, finger pointing, and hating America, when Crap-Hits-The –Fan who is it the world calls on to spend their wealth, give their supplies and to bleed and maybe die…..Americans. It isn’t the US government that fights and gives to the troubled parts of the world….It is the America People. So if Obama can’t handle that, he can resign anytime he decides this country, Its People, and Its Ideals are too much for him….. I think tomorrow would be a good day to get more ammo. This message has been edited. Last edited by: carsleyt, Sun 05 April 2009 06:22 PM

content: Gee, I wonder what happens when the speech is posted in context: In recent years we've allowed our Alliance to drift. I know that there have been honest disagreements over policy, but we also know that there's something more that has crept into our relationship. In America, there's a failure to appreciate Europe's leading role in the world. Instead of celebrating your dynamic union and seeking to partner with you to meet common challenges, there have been times where America has shown arrogance and been dismissive, even derisive. But in Europe, there is an anti-Americanism that is at once casual but can also be insidious. Instead of recognizing the good that America so often does in the world, there have been times where Europeans choose to blame America for much of what's bad. On both sides of the Atlantic, these attitudes have become all too common. They are not wise. They do not represent the truth. They threaten to widen the divide across the Atlantic and leave us both more isolated. They fail to acknowledge the fundamental truth that America cannot confront the challenges of this century alone, but that Europe cannot confront them without America.

content: This administration has been blaming our country quite a bit. SECSTATE Clinton, has blamed Mexico's problems on us. Attorney Gen Eric Holder has called us a nation of cowards. He also blamed US for Mexico's gun problem. With his false accusations, he even recommended restricting our second amendment rights on fabricated, and unfounded BS. He blamed US, instead of Mexico, their military (whom has deserted in astonishing numbers), the cartels, and so on. So now, Obama wants to disarm us, while other countries are looking to increase their arsenals. There is a reason for us maintaining our nuclear arsenal. It is called deterrence. Does he think that if he disarms us, everyone else will follow? It will only make us more vulnerable. The man needs to step into reality. NK just fired a missile. The words he used weren't strong. Rather, it was a weak scolding. When Reagan told Gorbachev to "tear down this wall"...was he there blaming previous administrations, trying to apologize and so on? Hell no. When he inherited a horrible economy, did he sit there, crying about Carter? No, he took action. Blaming and so on was handled at the debates. Now we have an administration that is blaming us for the worlds problems, instead of dealing with them. Or, they choose to deal with them trying to restrict our rights. That is a bunch of BS. How some of you can stand for it is beyond me.

Bows to sponsors of anti-Americanism, Olive Branch to terrorist organizations vowing the destruction of the West (us), bad mouthing America as the root of all that is wrong in the world. Not letting banks repay money to get out of Gov control, legislation to take control and/or shut down the internet. (They want to be able to look into any ones online activity, where are all the Bush wire tap whiners on this?) Firing people in private companies, wanting limited pay in private companies. West Wing Aides got millions for brokering Bail-out deals, no outrage. All these corrupted appointees. What is going on with this guy? How can some people keep blowing all this off as nothing? Maybe Arrogant comes from going all over the world every time there is trouble while Europe Sends usually token forces or supplies? Maybe Arrogance comes from giving more money to charity from Private Citizens than the value of many countries GDP? Maybe Arrogance comes from taking care of our citizens, Mexico-Central-and South American refugees from their impoverished and/or greedy leadership. Maybe Arrogance comes from being on the moon, creating more in our short couple centuries than Europe did in millennia. Maybe it come in the way our immigrants (legal ones anyway) assimilate here, yet riot and burn neighborhoods in France and plot to blow up planes with their babies in Britain. Maybe it is Arrogance in that we have a lower crime rate per capita than many countries that don’t allow a version of our 2nd Amendment. Maybe it is Arrogance in KNOWING that for all the whining, crying, finger pointing, and hating America, when Crap-Hits-The –Fan who is it the world calls on to spend their wealth, give their supplies and to bleed and maybe die…..Americans. It isn’t the US government that fights and gives to the troubled parts of the world….It is the America People. So if Obama can’t handle that, he can resign anytime he decides this country, Its People, and Its Ideals are too much for him….. I think tomorrow would be a good day to get more ammo. content: Gee, I wonder what happens when the speech is posted in context: In recent years we've allowed our Alliance to drift. I know that there have been honest disagreements over policy, but we also know that there's something more that has crept into our relationship. In America, there's a failure to appreciate Europe's leading role in the world. Instead of celebrating your dynamic union and seeking to partner with you to meet common challenges, there have been times where America has shown arrogance and been dismissive, even derisive. But in Europe, there is an anti-Americanism that is at once casual but can also be insidious. Instead of recognizing the good that America so often does in the world, there have been times where Europeans choose to blame America for much of what's bad. On both sides of the Atlantic, these attitudes have become all too common. They are not wise. They do not represent the truth. They threaten to widen the divide across the Atlantic and leave us both more isolated. They fail to acknowledge the fundamental truth that America cannot confront the challenges of this century alone, but that Europe cannot confront them without America.

content: This administration has been blaming our country quite a bit. SECSTATE Clinton, has blamed Mexico's problems on us. Attorney Gen Eric Holder has called us a nation of cowards. He also blamed US for Mexico's gun problem. With his false accusations, he even recommended restricting our second amendment rights on fabricated, and unfounded BS. He blamed US, instead of Mexico, their military (whom has deserted in astonishing numbers), the cartels, and so on. So now, Obama wants to disarm us, while other countries are looking to increase their arsenals. There is a reason for us maintaining our nuclear arsenal. It is called deterrence. Does he think that if he disarms us, everyone else will follow? It will only make us more vulnerable. The man needs to step into reality. NK just fired a missile. The words he used weren't strong. Rather, it was a weak scolding. When Reagan told Gorbachev to "tear down this wall"...was he there blaming previous administrations, trying to apologize and so on? Hell no. When he inherited a horrible economy, did he sit there, crying about Carter? No, he took action. Blaming and so on was handled at the debates. Now we have an administration that is blaming us for the worlds problems, instead of dealing with them. Or, they choose to deal with them trying to restrict our rights. That is a bunch of BS. How some of you can stand for it is beyond me.

title: Obama: America has been Arrogant.

content: All over the news, Google if ya want other POCs. *http://www.stoptheaclu.com/archives/2009/04/03/obama-calls-america-arrogant-during-speech-in-strasbourg/ Proud Arrogant American here, Obama bad mouthed us in Europe this week as such, I am proud to be one. *uc* Him! For a guy that wanted to be President so bad he sure doesn't seem to like anything about this country, or his wife till now for that matter. Think about it, OUR PRESIDENT BAD MOUTHED US, THE CITIZENS HE REPRESENTS, IN ANOTHER COUNTRY. More blame America First. Maybe he is in campaign mode again, going on for President of the NWO? What a sell-out. I don't care what your beliefs are,there is something going on with this. Bows to sponsors of anti-Americanism, Olive Branch to terrorist organizations vowing the destruction of the West (us), bad mouthing America as the root of all that is wrong in the world. Not letting banks repay money to get out of Gov control, legislation to take control and/or shut down the internet. (They want to be able to look into any ones online activity, where are all the Bush wire tap whiners on this?) Firing people in private companies, wanting limited pay in private companies. West Wing Aides got millions for brokering Bail-out deals, no outrage. All these corrupted appointees. What is going on with this guy? How can some people keep blowing all this off as nothing? Maybe Arrogant comes from going all over the world every time there is trouble while Europe Sends usually token forces or supplies? Maybe Arrogance comes from giving more money to charity from Private Citizens than the value of many countries GDP? Maybe Arrogance comes from taking care of our citizens, Mexico-Central-and South American refugees from their impoverished and/or greedy leadership. Maybe Arrogance comes from being on the moon, creating more in our short couple centuries than Europe did in millennia. Maybe it come in the way our immigrants (legal ones anyway) assimilate here, yet riot and burn neighborhoods in France and plot to blow up planes with their babies in Britain. Maybe it is Arrogance in that we have a lower crime rate per capita than many countries that don’t allow a version of our 2nd Amendment. Maybe it is Arrogance in KNOWING that for all the whining, crying, finger pointing, and hating America, when Crap-Hits-The –Fan who is it the world calls on to spend their wealth, give their supplies and to bleed and maybe die…..Americans. It isn’t the US government that fights and gives to the troubled parts of the world….It is the America People. So if Obama can’t handle that, he can resign anytime he decides this country, Its People, and Its Ideals are too much for him….. I think tomorrow would be a good day to get more ammo. This message has been edited. Last edited by: carsleyt, Sun 05 April 2009 06:22 PM

content: Gee, I wonder what happens when the speech is posted in context: In recent years we've allowed our Alliance to drift. I know that there have been honest disagreements over policy, but we also know that there's something more that has crept into our relationship. In America, there's a failure to appreciate Europe's leading role in the world. Instead of celebrating your dynamic union and seeking to partner with you to meet common challenges, there have been times where America has shown arrogance and been dismissive, even derisive. But in Europe, there is an anti-Americanism that is at once casual but can also be insidious. Instead of recognizing the good that America so often does in the world, there have been times where Europeans choose to blame America for much of what's bad. On both sides of the Atlantic, these attitudes have become all too common. They are not wise. They do not represent the truth. They threaten to widen the divide across the Atlantic and leave us both more isolated. They fail to acknowledge the fundamental truth that America cannot confront the challenges of this century alone, but that Europe cannot confront them without America.

content: SignalSgtWilliams and badmac933 have given good comments about this fiasco. There was no reason to equate the USA with Europe in making mistakes of "arrogance". It reminds me of Michelle's (his wife's) "For the first time I am proud to be an American". These are not simply TV slips of the tongue - the tell us about an attitude that is reflected in the detailed backgrounds of the people involved, because we know one heck of a lot about their backgrounds including long-time attending Church where the Ministers made these kinds of statements often, working/volunteering in organizations alongside Terrorists, and on and on. I don't know how many people on Military.com know of the Polls that have been made over the years about USA black Ethnic Group attitudes toward the USA, but they do tend to fall not only into Obama's and Michelle's statement types but often much worse including sympathy for Terrorists, for the USSR, for Russia, for China, for Cuba, for Criminals, etc. Osher Doctorow

content: This administration has been blaming our country quite a bit. SECSTATE Clinton, has blamed Mexico's problems on us. Attorney Gen Eric Holder has called us a nation of cowards. He also blamed US for Mexico's gun problem. With his false accusations, he even recommended restricting our second amendment rights on fabricated, and unfounded BS. He blamed US, instead of Mexico, their military (whom has deserted in astonishing numbers), the cartels, and so on. So now, Obama wants to disarm us, while other countries are looking to increase their arsenals. There is a reason for us maintaining our nuclear arsenal. It is called deterrence. Does he think that if he disarms us, everyone else will follow? It will only make us more vulnerable. The man needs to step into reality. NK just fired a missile. The words he used weren't strong. Rather, it was a weak scolding. When Reagan told Gorbachev to "tear down this wall"...was he there blaming previous administrations, trying to apologize and so on? Hell no. When he inherited a horrible economy, did he sit there, crying about Carter? No, he took action. Blaming and so on was handled at the debates. Now we have an administration that is blaming us for the worlds problems, instead of dealing with them. Or, they choose to deal with them trying to restrict our rights. That is a bunch of BS. How some of you can stand for it is beyond me.

content: All over the news, Google if ya want other POCs. *http://www.stoptheaclu.com/archives/2009/04/03/obama-calls-america-arrogant-during-speech-in-strasbourg/ Proud Arrogant American here, Obama bad mouthed us in Europe this week as such, I am proud to be one. *uc* Him! For a guy that wanted to be President so bad he sure doesn't seem to like anything about this country, or his wife till now for that matter. Think about it, OUR PRESIDENT BAD MOUTHED US, THE CITIZENS HE REPRESENTS, IN ANOTHER COUNTRY. More blame America First. Maybe he is in campaign mode again, going on for President of the NWO? What a sell-out. I don't care what your beliefs are,there is something going on with this. Bows to sponsors of anti-Americanism, Olive Branch to terrorist organizations vowing the destruction of the West (us), bad mouthing America as the root of all that is wrong in the world. Not letting banks repay money to get out of Gov control, legislation to take control and/or shut down the internet. (They want to be able to look into any ones online activity, where are all the Bush wire tap whiners on this?) Firing people in private companies, wanting limited pay in private companies. West Wing Aides got millions for brokering Bail-out deals, no outrage. All these corrupted appointees. What is going on with this guy? How can some people keep blowing all this off as nothing? Maybe Arrogant comes from going all over the world every time there is trouble while Europe Sends usually token forces or supplies? Maybe Arrogance comes from giving more money to charity from Private Citizens than the value of many countries GDP? Maybe Arrogance comes from taking care of our citizens, Mexico-Central-and South American refugees from their impoverished and/or greedy leadership. Maybe Arrogance comes from being on the moon, creating more in our short couple centuries than Europe did in millennia. Maybe it come in the way our immigrants (legal ones anyway) assimilate here, yet riot and burn neighborhoods in France and plot to blow up planes with their babies in Britain. Maybe it is Arrogance in that we have a lower crime rate per capita than many countries that don’t allow a version of our 2nd Amendment. Maybe it is Arrogance in KNOWING that for all the whining, crying, finger pointing, and hating America, when Crap-Hits-The –Fan who is it the world calls on to spend their wealth, give their supplies and to bleed and maybe die…..Americans. It isn’t the US government that fights and gives to the troubled parts of the world….It is the America People. So if Obama can’t handle that, he can resign anytime he decides this country, Its People, and Its Ideals are too much for him….. I think tomorrow would be a good day to get more ammo. This message has been edited. Last edited by: carsleyt, Sun 05 April 2009 06:22 PM

content: Gee, I wonder what happens when the speech is posted in context: In recent years we've allowed our Alliance to drift. I know that there have been honest disagreements over policy, but we also know that there's something more that has crept into our relationship. In America, there's a failure to appreciate Europe's leading role in the world. Instead of celebrating your dynamic union and seeking to partner with you to meet common challenges, there have been times where America has shown arrogance and been dismissive, even derisive. But in Europe, there is an anti-Americanism that is at once casual but can also be insidious. Instead of recognizing the good that America so often does in the world, there have been times where Europeans choose to blame America for much of what's bad. On both sides of the Atlantic, these attitudes have become all too common. They are not wise. They do not represent the truth. They threaten to widen the divide across the Atlantic and leave us both more isolated. They fail to acknowledge the fundamental truth that America cannot confront the challenges of this century alone, but that Europe cannot confront them without America.

content: This administration has been blaming our country quite a bit. SECSTATE Clinton, has blamed Mexico's problems on us. Attorney Gen Eric Holder has called us a nation of cowards. He also blamed US for Mexico's gun problem. With his false accusations, he even recommended restricting our second amendment rights on fabricated, and unfounded BS. He blamed US, instead of Mexico, their military (whom has deserted in astonishing numbers), the cartels, and so on. So now, Obama wants to disarm us, while other countries are looking to increase their arsenals. There is a reason for us maintaining our nuclear arsenal. It is called deterrence. Does he think that if he disarms us, everyone else will follow? It will only make us more vulnerable. The man needs to step into reality. NK just fired a missile. The words he used weren't strong. Rather, it was a weak scolding. When Reagan told Gorbachev to "tear down this wall"...was he there blaming previous administrations, trying to apologize and so on? Hell no. When he inherited a horrible economy, did he sit there, crying about Carter? No, he took action. Blaming and so on was handled at the debates. Now we have an administration that is blaming us for the worlds problems, instead of dealing with them. Or, they choose to deal with them trying to restrict our rights. That is a bunch of BS. How some of you can stand for it is beyond me.

Maybe Arrogance comes from taking care of our citizens, Mexico-Central-and South American refugees from their impoverished and/or greedy leadership. Maybe Arrogance comes from being on the moon, creating more in our short couple centuries than Europe did in millennia. Maybe it come in the way our immigrants (legal ones anyway) assimilate here, yet riot and burn neighborhoods in France and plot to blow up planes with their babies in Britain. Maybe it is Arrogance in that we have a lower crime rate per capita than many countries that don’t allow a version of our 2nd Amendment. Maybe it is Arrogance in KNOWING that for all the whining, crying, finger pointing, and hating America, when Crap-Hits-The –Fan who is it the world calls on to spend their wealth, give their supplies and to bleed and maybe die…..Americans. It isn’t the US government that fights and gives to the troubled parts of the world….It is the America People. So if Obama can’t handle that, he can resign anytime he decides this country, Its People, and Its Ideals are too much for him….. I think tomorrow would be a good day to get more ammo. content: Gee, I wonder what happens when the speech is posted in context: In recent years we've allowed our Alliance to drift. I know that there have been honest disagreements over policy, but we also know that there's something more that has crept into our relationship. In America, there's a failure to appreciate Europe's leading role in the world. Instead of celebrating your dynamic union and seeking to partner with you to meet common challenges, there have been times where America has shown arrogance and been dismissive, even derisive. But in Europe, there is an anti-Americanism that is at once casual but can also be insidious. Instead of recognizing the good that America so often does in the world, there have been times where Europeans choose to blame America for much of what's bad. On both sides of the Atlantic, these attitudes have become all too common. They are not wise. They do not represent the truth. They threaten to widen the divide across the Atlantic and leave us both more isolated. They fail to acknowledge the fundamental truth that America cannot confront the challenges of this century alone, but that Europe cannot confront them without America.

content: This administration has been blaming our country quite a bit. SECSTATE Clinton, has blamed Mexico's problems on us. Attorney Gen Eric Holder has called us a nation of cowards. He also blamed US for Mexico's gun problem. With his false accusations, he even recommended restricting our second amendment rights on fabricated, and unfounded BS. He blamed US, instead of Mexico, their military (whom has deserted in astonishing numbers), the cartels, and so on. So now, Obama wants to disarm us, while other countries are looking to increase their arsenals. There is a reason for us maintaining our nuclear arsenal. It is called deterrence. Does he think that if he disarms us, everyone else will follow? It will only make us more vulnerable. The man needs to step into reality. NK just fired a missile. The words he used weren't strong. Rather, it was a weak scolding. When Reagan told Gorbachev to "tear down this wall"...was he there blaming previous administrations, trying to apologize and so on? Hell no. When he inherited a horrible economy, did he sit there, crying about Carter? No, he took action. Blaming and so on was handled at the debates. Now we have an administration that is blaming us for the worlds problems, instead of dealing with them. Or, they choose to deal with them trying to restrict our rights. That is a bunch of BS. How some of you can stand for it is beyond me.
